Curaçao

In 1825 the United Protestant Congregation was created from the Reformed community (since 1635 on Curaçao) and the Lutheran congregation (since 1755 on Curaçao). On the order of King Willem I, both denominations were to be united. The reunion took place in a ceremony on 24 April 1825.

 

Bonaire

On Bonaire in 1816 there were about 100 Protestants (Reformed and Lutheran) without a church organization. From 1841 to 1860 the Minister of Curaçao was obliged - by Royal Decree (KB) - to visit Bonaire regularly. The arrival of A.I.K. Meyer and his first service in July 1843 are considered the beginning of a Protestant community on Bonaire. Meyer also built a church.
